evidence_span: A series of isothermal investigations have been performed in static autoclaves at $6 2 3 \ \mathrm { K }$ in both standard start of cycle coolant and a series of more concentrated lithium and lithium-boron solutions

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_040_chunk1
evidence_span: In solutions containing $2 2 0 \mathsf { p p m }$ of lithium. the presence of as little as 50 ppm of boron had a marked ameliorating effect on the corrosion rates of Zircaloy-4.

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_040_chunk1
evidence_span: The quantity of lithium which became incorporated in the scale was less in the presence of boron and, in general, decreased as the boron concentration in the bulk solution increased.

evidence_span: Preliminary results under heat flux in similarly concentrated environments have suggested that the results are also applicable to the real situation in a reactor

conditions.medium: solution containing 220 ppm lithium with 8000 ppm boron

evidence_span: The presence of as little as $5 0 \mathrm { p p m }$ of boron, which is only one twentieth of the amount added to coolant at the start of a PWR operating cycle, has been shown to dramatically reduce corrosion rates in an environment containing $2 2 0 \ \mathsf { p p m }$ of lithium.
